clinical_study.brief_title: Early Use of Noninvasive Positive Pressure Ventilation for Intro-pulmonary Acute Lung Injury

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the safety and efficacy of noninvasive positive pressure ventilation for patients with intro-pulmonary pulmonary acute lung injury and compare this with high-concentration oxygen therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: numbers of patients who met the intubation criteria
the numbers of patients who are actually intubated

intervention.description: Patients in the NPPV group are ventilated using the CPAP or bilevel positive airways pressure S/T mode.
In the control group, Venturi masks are used to maintain SpO2 at 92% to 96% by adjusting the oxygen flow rates.
